metadata.name: 7Zip Compressing Dump Files
metadata.comment: Detects execution of 7z in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(device.desc), lower('7-zip')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\7z.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\7zr.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\7za.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('7z\.exe', '7za\.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dmp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dump')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.hdmp'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of 7z in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate use of 7z with a command line in which ".dmp" or ".dump" appears accidentally 2. Legitimate use of 7z to compress WER ".dmp" files for troubleshooting Reference: https://thedfirreport.com/2022/09/26/bumblebee-round-two/
